sub_topic: Using the Fourier transform to solve boundary value problems
message_1:
A metal plate of length 10 cm and width 8 cm has a temperature distribution given by:

$$
T(x,y) = \sin(2\pi x/10) \sin(3\pi y/8)
$$

Use Fourier transform to find the temperature distribution when $x = 5$.
message_2:
To find the temperature distribution when $x = 5$, we can simply plug in the value of $x$ into the given temperature distribution function:

$$
T(5,y) = \sin(2\pi (5)/10) \sin(3\pi y/8)
$$

Simplify the expression:

$$
T(5,y) = \sin(\pi) \sin(3\pi y/8)
$$

Since $\sin(\pi) = 0$, the temperature distribution when $x = 5$ is:

$$
T(5,y) = 0 \cdot \sin(3\pi y/8) = 0
$$

So, the temperature distribution is 0 when $x = 5$.
